Section 6.title: Definitions in the Code to be understood subject to exceptions
Section 6.description: Whenever the word 'offence' is used in the Code, it should be interpreted subject to the general and special exceptions provided.

Section 141.title: Unlawful assembly
Section 141.description: An assembly of five or more persons is designated an 'unlawful assembly' if the common object is to overawe the government, resist law, or commit offences.

Section 144.title: Power to issue order in urgent cases of nuisance or apprehended danger
Section 144.description: A District Magistrate, Sub-divisional Magistrate or Executive Magistrate may issue an order in urgent cases to prevent nuisance or danger.

Section 302.title: Punishment for murder
Section 302.description: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

Section 304.title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
Section 304.description: Punishment may include imprisonment for life or up to ten years depending on intention and gravity.

Section 378.title: Theft
Section 378.description: Whoever, intending to take dishonestly any movable property out of the possession of any person, moves that property, is said to commit theft.

Section 420.title: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
Section 420.description: Whoever cheats and dishonestly induces any person to deliver any property shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years and fine.
